About Us

The COVID-19 crisis has caused serious disruptions to the way we consume our food. Since the dine-in ban started, Food & Beverages (F&B) businesses are scrambling to adapt their kitchen for deliveries and pickups.

Independent restaurants and bars that have not joined food delivery platforms are among the worst hit. To help our F&B businesses who are feeling both the financial and emotional strain of this unprecedented crisis, we decided to kickstart FindFood.SG.

FindFood.SG is a platform that helps consumers discover food options from independent restaurants and bars islandwide and not on food delivery platforms. You can search for both delivery and pickup options and get connected to the F&B businesses directly via their preferred mode of communication.

There is no cost to use FindFood.SG and to list on the platform.

FAQ
What’s the difference between FindFood.SG and other grounds up initiatives on social media?

We are so delighted that the larger Singapore community is coming together to save our F&B business. Some of these successful initiatives have gathered more than tens of thousands of members!

Each of these initiatives have their own unique selling point. Social media groups are a great way to build a community but might make searching a little harder. FindFood.SG aims to solve the discovery process by making it easy to search across all F&B businesses listed and filter them to your location and preferences.

What is the difference between FindFood.SG and the food delivery platforms?

The food delivery platform model does not work for all F&B businesses; many F&B businesses are still not on food delivery platforms for a variety of reasons including cost and time to set up.

This is where FindFood.SG comes in. We help F&B businesses who do not wish to get on the food delivery platforms to be discovered.

Please also note that we do not handle ordering or delivery options on behalf of the F&B businesses. FindFood.SG connects consumers and F&B businesses directly, so F&B businesses keep 100% of the sale they make. On top of that, FindFood.SG is completely free to use for both consumers and the F&B businesses.

People Behind FindFood.SG
Ivan Chang
Adjunct Faculty Mentor, Singapore Management University Co-Opted Councilor, SGTech
Ivan Chang serves as the Co-Founder and Former Executive Chairman of Wonder Group. Through its nine campuses in Vietnam, Indonesia, Philippines, Singapore, Sri Lanka and Ukraine, the company helps clients build and manage offshore software development teams. As the Executive Chairman, Ivan also oversees investor relations and helped the firm close a multi-million funding round in 2015 from Singapore Press Holdings and Plug and Play US.
Lim Qing Ru
Co-Founder, Zopim.com, Board Member, ACE.SG , Board Member, NUS Faculty of Arts and Social Science
Qing Ru cofounded Zopim, a live chat software, which was sold to Zendesk (NYSE:ZEN) in 2014. Since then, she has been an active angel investor, with close to 20 companies in her personal portfolio. Currently, she’s a Partner at True Global Ventures 4th Fund which invests exclusively in blockchain startups. She was the commencement speaker for NUS FASS in 2015.
Michel Lu
Executive Director, Revolver Asia / Beluga Capital / Global Kitchens / Liquid Assets
Having been owner and operator in food and beverage, venture capital and lifestyle businesses in Asia for over two decades, Michel combines robust, time-tested strategies with creative new ideas and opportunities to grow companies into successful, profitable and enduring entities. Many of these have become iconic brands in prominent Asian markets such as China, Hong Kong, Macau, Indonesia, Malaysia and Singapore, and Michel is often referred to as a ‘lifestyle guru’ by the media.
Sharon Neo
Founder, Digital Influence Lab / Digital Marketing Summit Asia
Sharon is founder of Digital Influence Lab that was appointed by the Singapore Government to help local SMEs digitalize and build their digital marketing capabilities. As an active community leader, Sharon also founded Digital Marketing Summit Asia, the largest virtual event for marketers in Asia Pacific. These digital entrepreneurial pursuits likely began when they started importing Taiwanese popstar merchandise to sell on the Internet as a teenager.

Isolation Economy Course for F&B Industry

Join Michel, Ivan, and Sharon for a crash course on how to best adapt your F&B business to this rapidly changing environment, as they tackle financial, operational, digital, and marketing issues with you. The course is by SMU Academy and funded by SkillsFuture Singapore. There is no silver bullet to survive through this crisis but we can collectively make the best out of the situation.

https://www.isolation.sg/fnb.html
